chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Vereen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard W Vereen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard W Vereen was found guilty of Operating while Revoked/Suspended. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Richard W Vereen was found guilty of Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: A six month commitment order will be imposed, due to non-payment and is to run consecutive to any sentence defendant may be serving at that time.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard W Vereen

records.addlTxt: 11:00 AM Defendant Richard W Vereen in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton - who appears via Zoom.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG plea to all counts, defendant is in the Courtroom today even though an Auth to Appear is filed - needs to sign his bond. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for JT, notices will not include Zoom information as the Courthouse is now open.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:30 AM Defendant Richard W Vereen appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions if Vereen if he has an attorney. Vereen indicates he does qualify for SPD and talked with them yesterday, they indicated they may have someone to appear with him today. Court questions why he waited until yesterday to call SPD. Court also questions why he has not returned the bond. Vereen indicates he never received. Court orders Vereen to appear in person for next hearing and can sign bond at that time, keep in close contact with SPD, court will continue bond and has set for AIA March 16, 2022 at 11:00 AM.
Must sign and return to Clerk of Court within 10 days
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:03 AM Defendant Richard W Vereen appeared by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appeared by video. CC and CR appear by video, Vereen has received a copy of complaint and indicates he received a letter from COC regarding bond being released. Clerk explains process of holding/releasing bond. Court also explains process to Vereen and reads charges and penalties. Vereen understands and questions IID charge. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Vereen responds and will contact an attorney for private hire. Court advises of options of retaining an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed. State asks for $100 signature bond. Court sets bond at $100 signature bond and condition to sign bond and return to COC within 10 days. AIA set for March 2, 2022 at 9:30 AM.  Vereen asks for more time. Court advises he has a month to try to obtain an attorney.
